device_mount: Handheld; Placed loosely around user (e.g., table)
evaluation: User study (quantitative, controlled lab experiment); User study (qualitative)
contribution_desc:
This paper presents a usability study of using a mobile phone as a personal, general-purpose tangible controller for interacting with tabletops. It compares three different forms of interaction: direct touch, phone as a tangible control physically on the tabletop, and phone as a remote control (through the user interface) away from tabletop.

Contribution: "cross-device interaction" -> "study" -> "usability & user experience" -> "remote control"

Study measures: "task time", "task accuracy", "subjective workload", "social acceptability", "practicality/usefulness"
